title: Muslims barred from playing Ram, Laxman, Sita in Faizabad’s Ramlila; Reason: They eat meat
text:
Muslims barred from playing Ram, Laxman, Sita in Faizabad’s Ramlila; Reason: They eat meat By Mohammed Uzair Shaikh on October 19, 2015 at 3:10 PM Comments 
Faizabad, Oct 19: In a five-decade old inter-community Ramilila organized in Uttar Pradesh’s Faizabad, a new regulation has been imposed. The Muslims who have been regular participants in the holy re-enactment will not be allowed to play the role of revered figures such as Lord Ram, Laxman, Sita and Hanuman. The reason behind this sudden imposition is that the members of minority community eat meat, and therefore it would be disrespectful if they enact Gods. 
The Ramlila is conducted in the Muslim neighbourhood of Mumtaznagar. A number of members including one of the event organizer Baldhari Yadav have objected to the role of holy figures handed to Muslims. “Women spectators worship the feet of actors playing Ram, Sita, Laxman, etc. Since, they eat meat it is disrespectful. Although, Hindus too are non-vegetarians, they give up eating meat during Navratri,” he said. (ALSO READ: Re-propagation of ‘Love Jihad’: Navratri round the corner, fringe urge Hindus to exclude Muslims from garba) 
According to chief event planner Majid Ali, a number of complaints were received from local Hindus raising apprehensions over Muslims playing the lead roles. “Their objection was that since Muslims eat meat, they shouldn’t enact the role of gods. When we came to know about the objections, we eased them out,” he was quoted as saying by TOI.
